translations.translation: O  dear father! I have certainly received some knowledge which you have not received, so follow me and I will guide you to the Straight Path.

verses.text: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لَا تَعْبُدِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَصِيًّا

translations.translation: O  dear father! Do not worship Satan. Surely Satan is ever rebellious against the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٌ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيْطَـٰنِ وَلِيًّا

translations.translation: O  dear father! I truly fear that you will be touched by a torment from the Most Compassionate, and become Satan’s companion [in Hell].”

verses.text: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنْ ءَالِهَتِى يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ لَأَرْجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَٱهْجُرْنِى مَلِيًّا

translations.translation: He threatened, “How dare you reject my idols, O  Abraham! If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you [to death]. So be gone from me for a long time!”

verses.text: قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكَ ۖ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِى حَفِيًّا

translations.translation: Abraham responded, “Peace be upon you! I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness. He has truly been Most Gracious to me.

verses.text: وَأَعْتَزِلُكُمْ وَمَا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى عَسَىٰٓ أَلَّآ أَكُونَ بِدُعَآءِ رَبِّى شَقِيًّا

translations.translation: As I distance myself from [all of] you and from whatever you invoke besides Allah, I will [continue to] call upon my Lord [alone], trusting that I will never be disappointed in invoking my Lord.”

verses.text: فَلَمَّا ٱعْتَزَلَهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا نَبِيًّا

translations.translation: So after he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet.

verses.text: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّا

translations.translation: We showered them with Our mercy, and blessed them with honourable mention.

verses.text: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مُوسَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مُخْلَصًا وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا

translations.translation: And mention in the Book [O Prophet, the story of] Moses. He was truly a chosen man, and was a messenger and a prophet.

verses.text: وَنَـٰدَيْنَـٰهُ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلْأَيْمَنِ وَقَرَّبْنَـٰهُ نَجِيًّا

translations.translation: We called him from the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and drew him near, speaking [with him] directly.

verses.text: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥ مِن رَّحْمَتِنَآ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ نَبِيًّا

translations.translation: And We appointed for him—out of Our grace—his brother, Aaron, as a prophet.

verses.text: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صَادِقَ ٱلْوَعْدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا

translations.translation: And mention in the Book [O Prophet, the story of] Ishmael. He was truly a man of his word, and was a messenger and a prophet.

verses.text: وَكَانَ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُۥ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ مَرْضِيًّا

translations.translation: He used to urge his people to pray and give alms-tax. And his Lord was well pleased with him.

verses.text: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِدْرِيسَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا

translations.translation: And mention in the Book [O Prophet, the story of] Enoch. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.

verses.text: وَرَفَعْنَـٰهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا

translations.translation: And We elevated him to an honourable status.

verses.text: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنْعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءَادَمَ وَمِمَّنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَمِمَّنْ هَدَيْنَا وَٱجْتَبَيْنَآ ۚ إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ خَرُّوا۟ سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا ۩

translations.translation: Those were [some of] the prophets who Allah has blessed from among the descendants of Adam, and of those We carried with Noah [in the Ark], and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those We [rightly] guided and chose. Whenever the revelations of the Most Compassionate were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping.

verses.text: فَخَلَفَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ أَضَاعُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَلْقَوْنَ غَيًّا

translations.translation: But they were succeeded by generations who neglected prayer and followed their lusts and so will soon face the evil consequences.

verses.text: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ شَيْـًٔا

translations.translation: As for those who repent, believe, and do good, it is they who will be admitted into Paradise, never being denied any reward.

verses.text: جَنَّـٰتِ عَدْنٍ ٱلَّتِى وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ عِبَادَهُۥ بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَأْتِيًّا

translations.translation: [They will be in] the Gardens of Eternity, promised in trust by the Most Compassionate to His servants. Surely His promise will be fulfilled.

verses.text: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا إِلَّا سَلَـٰمًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ رِزْقُهُمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا

translations.translation: There they will never hear any idle talk—only [greetings of] peace. And there they will have their provisions morning and evening.

verses.text: تِلْكَ ٱلْجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِى نُورِثُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا مَن كَانَ تَقِيًّا

translations.translation: That is Paradise, which We will grant to whoever is devout among Our servants.

verses.text: وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمْرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُۥ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِينَا وَمَا خَلْفَنَا وَمَا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا

translations.translation: “We only descend by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us, and whatever is behind us, and everything in between. And your Lord is never forgetful.

verses.text: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَٱعْبُدْهُ وَٱصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَـٰدَتِهِۦ ۚ هَلْ تَعْلَمُ لَهُۥ سَمِيًّا

translations.translation: [He is the] Lord of the heavens, and the earth, and everything in between. So worship Him [alone], and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him [in His attributes]?”

verses.text: وَيَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا

translations.translation: Yet [some] people ask [mockingly], “After I die, will I really be raised to life again?”

verses.text: أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْـًٔا

translations.translation: Do [such] people not remember that We created them before, when they were nothing?

verses.text: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ وَٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ حَوْلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا

translations.translation: By your Lord [O Prophet]! We will surely gather them along with the devils, and then set them around Hell on their knees.

verses.text: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ أَشَدُّ عَلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عِتِيًّا

translations.translation: Then We will certainly begin by dragging out of every group the ones most defiant to the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: ثُمَّ لَنَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيًّا

translations.translation: And We truly know best who is most deserving of burning in it.

verses.text: وَإِن مِّنكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتْمًا مَّقْضِيًّا

translations.translation: There is none of you who will not pass over it. [This is] a decree your Lord must fulfil.

verses.text: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّنَذَرُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيًّا

translations.translation: Then We will deliver those who were devout, leaving the wrongdoers there on their knees.

verses.text: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَىُّ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ خَيْرٌ مَّقَامًا وَأَحْسَنُ نَدِيًّا

translations.translation: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers ask the believers [mockingly], “Which of the two of us is better in status and superior in assembly?”

verses.text: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَحْسَنُ أَثَـٰثًا وَرِءْيًا

translations.translation: [Imagine, O  Prophet] how many peoples We have destroyed before them, who were far better in luxury and splendour!

verses.text: قُلْ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا ٱلْعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضْعَفُ جُندًا

translations.translation: Say, [O Prophet,] “Whoever is [entrenched] in misguidance, the Most Compassionate will allow them plenty of time, until—behold!—they face what they are threatened with: either the torment or the Hour. Only then will they realize who is worse in position and inferior in manpower.”

verses.text: وَيَزِيدُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱهْتَدَوْا۟ هُدًى ۗ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ مَّرَدًّا

translations.translation: And Allah increases in guidance those who are [rightly] guided. And the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in outcome.

verses.text: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى كَفَرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا

translations.translation: Have you seen [O Prophet] the one who rejects Our revelations yet boasts, “I will definitely be granted [plenty of] wealth and children [if there is an afterlife].”?

verses.text: أَطَّلَعَ ٱلْغَيْبَ أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًا

translations.translation: Has he looked into the unseen or taken a pledge from the Most Compassionate?

verses.text: كَلَّا ۚ سَنَكْتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ مَدًّا

translations.translation: Not at all! We certainly record whatever he claims and will increase his punishment extensively.

verses.text: وَنَرِثُهُۥ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأْتِينَا فَرْدًا

translations.translation: And We will inherit what he boasts of, and he will come before Us all by himself.

verses.text: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةً لِّيَكُونُوا۟ لَهُمْ عِزًّا

translations.translation: They have taken other gods, instead of Allah, seeking strength [and protection] through them.

verses.text: كَلَّا ۚ سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا

translations.translation: But no! Those [gods] will deny their worship and turn against them.

verses.text: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّا

translations.translation: Do you [O Prophet] not see that We have sent the devils against the disbelievers, constantly inciting them?

verses.text: فَلَا تَعْجَلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ عَدًّا

translations.translation: So do not be in haste against them, for indeed We are [closely] counting down their days.

verses.text: يَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَفْدًا

translations.translation: [Watch for] the Day We will gather the righteous before the Most Compassionate as an honoured delegation,

verses.text: وَنَسُوقُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرْدًا

translations.translation: and drive the wicked to Hell like a thirsty herd.

verses.text: لَّا يَمْلِكُونَ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًا

translations.translation: None will have the right to intercede, except those who have taken a covenant from the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَلَدًا

translations.translation: They say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring.”

verses.text: لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِدًّا

translations.translation: You have certainly made an outrageous claim,

verses.text: تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ ٱلْجِبَالُ هَدًّا

translations.translation: by which the heavens are about to burst, the earth to split apart, and the mountains to crumble to pieces

verses.text: أَن دَعَوْا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَلَدًا

translations.translation: in protest of attributing children to the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا

translations.translation: It does not befit [the majesty of] the Most Compassionate to have children.

verses.text: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَبْدًا

translations.translation: There is none in the heavens or the earth who will not return to the Most Compassionate in full submission.

verses.text: لَّقَدْ أَحْصَىٰهُمْ وَعَدَّهُمْ عَدًّا

translations.translation: Indeed, He fully knows them and has counted them precisely.

verses.text: وَكُلُّهُمْ ءَاتِيهِ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَرْدًا

translations.translation: And each of them will return to Him on the Day of Judgment all alone.

verses.text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ سَيَجْعَلُ لَهُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وُدًّا

translations.translation: As for those who believe and do good, the Most Compassionate will [certainly] bless them with [genuine] love.

verses.text: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَـٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ قَوْمًا لُّدًّا

translations.translation: Indeed, We have made this [Quran] easy in your own language [O Prophet] so with it you may give good news to the righteous and warn those who are contentious.

verses.text: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هَلْ تُحِسُّ مِنْهُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَوْ تَسْمَعُ لَهُمْ رِكْزًۢا

translations.translation: [Imagine] how many peoples We have destroyed before them! Do you [still] see any of them, or [even] hear from them the slightest sound?

verses.text: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ طه

translations.translation: Ṭâ-Hâ.

verses.text: مَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِتَشْقَىٰٓ

translations.translation: We have not revealed the Quran to you [O Prophet] to cause you distress,

verses.text: إِلَّا تَذْكِرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰ

translations.translation: but as a reminder to those in awe [of Allah].

verses.text: تَنزِيلًا مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ ٱلْعُلَى

translations.translation: [It is] a revelation from the One Who created the earth and the high heavens—

verses.text: ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱسْتَوَىٰ

translations.translation: the Most Compassionate, [Who is] established on the Throne.

verses.text: لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ ٱلثَّرَىٰ

translations.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is in between and whatever is underground.

verses.text: وَإِن تَجْهَرْ بِٱلْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلسِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى

translations.translation: Whether you speak openly [or not], He certainly knows what is secret and what is even more hidden.

verses.text: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah—there is no god [worthy of worship] except Him. He has the Most Beautiful Names.

verses.text: وَهَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ

translations.translation: Has the story of Moses reached you [O Prophet]?

verses.text: إِذْ رَءَا نَارًا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ ٱمْكُثُوٓا۟ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّىٓ ءَاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ هُدًى

translations.translation: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Wait here, [for] I have spotted a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a torch from it, or find some guidance at the fire.”

verses.text: فَلَمَّآ أَتَىٰهَا نُودِىَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ

translations.translation: But when he approached it, he was called, “O Moses!

verses.text: إِنِّىٓ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكَ فَٱخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

translations.translation: It is truly I. I am your Lord! So take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Ṭuwa.

verses.text: وَأَنَا ٱخْتَرْتُكَ فَٱسْتَمِعْ لِمَا يُوحَىٰٓ

translations.translation: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed:

verses.text: إِنَّنِىٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱعْبُدْنِى وَأَقِمِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ لِذِكْرِىٓ

translations.translation: ‘It is truly I. I am Allah! There is no god [worthy of worship] except Me. So worship Me [alone], and establish prayer for My remembrance.

verses.text: إِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ ءَاتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ

translations.translation: The Hour is sure to come. My Will is to keep it hidden, so that every soul may be rewarded according to their efforts.

verses.text: فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَن لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ

translations.translation: So do not let those who disbelieve in it and follow their desires distract you from it, or you will be doomed.’”

verses.text: وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: [Allah added,] “And what is that in your right hand, O  Moses?”

verses.text: قَالَ هِىَ عَصَاىَ أَتَوَكَّؤُا۟ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِى وَلِىَ فِيهَا مَـَٔارِبُ أُخْرَىٰ

translations.translation: He replied, “It is my staff! I lean on it, and with it I beat down [branches] for my sheep, and have other uses for it.”

verses.text: قَالَ أَلْقِهَا يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah said, “Throw it down, O  Moses!”

verses.text: فَأَلْقَىٰهَا فَإِذَا هِىَ حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَىٰ

translations.translation: So he did, then—behold!—it became a serpent, slithering.

verses.text: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah said, “Take it, and have no fear. We will return it to its former state.

verses.text: وَٱضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍ ءَايَةً أُخْرَىٰ

translations.translation: And put your hand under your armpit, it will come out [shining] white, unblemished, as another sign,

verses.text: لِنُرِيَكَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا ٱلْكُبْرَى

translations.translation: so that We may show you some of Our greatest signs.

verses.text: ٱذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

translations.translation: Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed [all bounds].”

verses.text: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱشْرَحْ لِى صَدْرِى

translations.translation: Moses prayed, “My Lord! Uplift my heart for me,

verses.text: وَيَسِّرْ لِىٓ أَمْرِى

translations.translation: and make my task easy,

verses.text: وَٱحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّن لِّسَانِى

translations.translation: and remove the impediment from my tongue

verses.text: يَفْقَهُوا۟ قَوْلِى

translations.translation: so people may understand my speech,

verses.text: وَٱجْعَل لِّى وَزِيرًا مِّنْ أَهْلِى

translations.translation: and grant me a helper from my family,

verses.text: هَـٰرُونَ أَخِى

translations.translation: Aaron, my brother.

verses.text: ٱشْدُدْ بِهِۦٓ أَزْرِى

translations.translation: Strengthen me through him,

verses.text: وَأَشْرِكْهُ فِىٓ أَمْرِى

translations.translation: and let him share my task,

verses.text: كَىْ نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثِيرًا

translations.translation: so that we may glorify You much

verses.text: وَنَذْكُرَكَ كَثِيرًا

translations.translation: and remember You much,

verses.text: إِنَّكَ كُنتَ بِنَا بَصِيرًا

translations.translation: for truly You have [always] been overseeing us.”

verses.text: قَالَ قَدْ أُوتِيتَ سُؤْلَكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah responded, “All that you requested has been granted, O  Moses!

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَيْكَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَىٰٓ

translations.translation: And surely We had shown you favour before,

verses.text: إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ

translations.translation: when We inspired your mother with this:

verses.text: أَنِ ٱقْذِفِيهِ فِى ٱلتَّابُوتِ فَٱقْذِفِيهِ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ ٱلْيَمُّ بِٱلسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّ لِّى وَعَدُوٌّ لَّهُۥ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةً مِّنِّى وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِىٓ

translations.translation: ‘Put him into a chest, then put it into the river. The river will wash it ashore, and he will be taken by [Pharaoh,] an enemy of Mine and his.’ And I endeared you with love from Me [O Moses] so that you would be brought up under My [watchful] Eye.

verses.text: إِذْ تَمْشِىٓ أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن يَكْفُلُهُۥ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَـٰكَ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّكَ كَىْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا فَنَجَّيْنَـٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّـٰكَ فُتُونًا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِىٓ أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: [Remember] when your sister came along and proposed, ‘Shall I direct you to someone who will nurse him?’ So We reunited you with your mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and she would not grieve. [Later] you killed a man [by mistake], but We saved you from sorrow, as well as other tests We put you through. Then you stayed for a number of years among the people of Midian. Then you came here as pre-destined, O  Moses!

verses.text: وَٱصْطَنَعْتُكَ لِنَفْسِى

translations.translation: And I have selected you for My service.

verses.text: ٱذْهَبْ أَنتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِى وَلَا تَنِيَا فِى ذِكْرِى

translations.translation: Go forth, you and your brother, with My signs and never falter in remembering Me.

verses.text: ٱذْهَبَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

translations.translation: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed [all bounds].

verses.text: فَقُولَا لَهُۥ قَوْلًا لَّيِّنًا لَّعَلَّهُۥ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ

translations.translation: Speak to him gently, so perhaps he may be mindful [of Me] or fearful [of My punishment].”

verses.text: قَالَا رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَآ أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ

translations.translation: They both pleaded, “Our Lord! We fear that he may be quick to harm us or act tyrannically.”

verses.text: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَآ ۖ إِنَّنِى مَعَكُمَآ أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah reassured [them], “Have no fear! I am with you, hearing and seeing.

verses.text: فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ وَٱلسَّلَـٰمُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ

translations.translation: So go to him and say, ‘Indeed we are both messengers from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And salvation will be for whoever follows the [right] guidance.

verses.text: إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْنَآ أَنَّ ٱلْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

translations.translation: It has indeed been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies [the truth] and turns away.’”

verses.text: قَالَ فَمَن رَّبُّكُمَا يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: Pharaoh asked, “Who then is the Lord of you two, O  Moses?”

verses.text: قَالَ رَبُّنَا ٱلَّذِىٓ أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلْقَهُۥ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ

translations.translation: He answered, “Our Lord is the One Who has given everything its [distinctive] form, then guided [it].”

verses.text: قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ ٱلْقُرُونِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ

translations.translation: Pharaoh asked, “And what about previous peoples?”

verses.text: قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّى فِى كِتَـٰبٍ ۖ لَّا يَضِلُّ رَبِّى وَلَا يَنسَى

translations.translation: He replied, “That knowledge is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither falters nor forgets [anything].”

verses.text: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًا مِّن نَّبَاتٍ شَتَّىٰ

translations.translation: [He is the One] Who has laid out the earth for [all of] you, and set in it pathways for you, and sends down rain from the sky, causing various types of plants to grow,

verses.text: كُلُوا۟ وَٱرْعَوْا۟ أَنْعَـٰمَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ

translations.translation: [so] eat and graze your cattle. Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

verses.text: مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ

translations.translation: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you back again.

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَـٰهُ ءَايَـٰتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ

translations.translation: And We certainly showed Pharaoh all of Our signs, but he denied them and refused [to believe].

verses.text: قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: He said, “Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O  Moses?

verses.text: فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍ مِّثْلِهِۦ فَٱجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَّا نُخْلِفُهُۥ نَحْنُ وَلَآ أَنتَ مَكَانًا سُوًى

translations.translation: We can surely meet you with similar magic. So set for us an appointment that neither of us will fail to keep, in a central place.”

verses.text: قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ ٱلزِّينَةِ وَأَن يُحْشَرَ ٱلنَّاسُ ضُحًى

translations.translation: Moses said, “Your appointment is on the Day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered mid-morning.”

verses.text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُۥ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ

translations.translation: Pharaoh then withdrew, orchestrated his scheme, then returned.

verses.text: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسْحِتَكُم بِعَذَابٍ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ

translations.translation: Moses warned the magicians, “Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah, or He will wipe you out with a torment. Whoever fabricates [lies] is bound to fail.”

verses.text: فَتَنَـٰزَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ

translations.translation: So the magicians disputed the matter among themselves, conversing privately.

verses.text: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَٰنِ لَسَـٰحِرَٰنِ يُرِيدَانِ أَن يُخْرِجَاكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ ٱلْمُثْلَىٰ

translations.translation: They concluded, “These two are only magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic, and do away with your most cherished traditions.

verses.text: فَأَجْمِعُوا۟ كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ٱئْتُوا۟ صَفًّا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ ٱلْيَوْمَ مَنِ ٱسْتَعْلَىٰ

translations.translation: So orchestrate your plan, then come forward in [perfect] ranks. And whoever prevails today will certainly be successful.”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِمَّآ أَن تُلْقِىَ وَإِمَّآ أَن نَّكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ

translations.translation: They said, “O Moses! Either you cast, or let us be the first to cast.”

verses.text: قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا۟ ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِن سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ

translations.translation: Moses responded, “No, you go first.” And suddenly their ropes and staffs appeared to him—by their magic—to be slithering.

verses.text: فَأَوْجَسَ فِى نَفْسِهِۦ خِيفَةً مُّوسَىٰ

translations.translation: So Moses concealed fear within himself.

verses.text: قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ

translations.translation: We reassured [him], “Do not fear! It is certainly you who will prevail.

verses.text: وَأَلْقِ مَا فِى يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا۟ كَيْدُ سَـٰحِرٍ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلسَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ

translations.translation: Cast what is in your right hand, and it will swallow up what they have made, for what they have made is no more than a magic trick. And magicians can never succeed wherever they go.”

verses.text: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَـٰرُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration, declaring, “We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

verses.text: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِى جُذُوعِ ٱلنَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَآ أَشَدُّ عَذَابًا وَأَبْقَىٰ

translations.translation: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. You will really see whose punishment is more severe and more lasting.”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ لَن نُّؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَآءَنَا مِنَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَٱقْضِ مَآ أَنتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَآ

translations.translation: They responded, “By the One Who created us! We will never prefer you over the clear proofs that have come to us. So do whatever you want! Your authority only covers the [fleeting] life of this world.

verses.text: إِنَّآ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَا وَمَآ أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلسِّحْرِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ

translations.translation: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord so He may forgive our sins and that magic you have forced us to practice. And Allah is far superior [in reward] and more lasting [in punishment].”

verses.text: إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَأْتِ رَبَّهُۥ مُجْرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ

translations.translation: Whoever comes to their Lord as an evildoer will certainly have Hell, where they can neither live nor die.

verses.text: وَمَن يَأْتِهِۦ مُؤْمِنًا قَدْ عَمِلَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱلدَّرَجَـٰتُ ٱلْعُلَىٰ

translations.translation: But whoever comes to Him as a believer, having done good, they will have the highest ranks:

verses.text: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَآءُ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ

translations.translation: the Gardens of Eternity, under which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves.

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِى فَٱضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًا فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ يَبَسًا لَّا تَخَـٰفُ دَرَكًا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ

translations.translation: And We surely inspired Moses, [saying,] “Leave with My servants [at night] and strike a dry passage for them across the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be concerned [of drowning].”

verses.text: فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِۦ فَغَشِيَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ

translations.translation: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers—but how overwhelming were the waters that submerged them!

verses.text: وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُۥ وَمَا هَدَىٰ

translations.translation: And [so] Pharaoh led his people astray, and did not guide [them rightly].

verses.text: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ قَدْ أَنجَيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَٰعَدْنَـٰكُمْ جَانِبَ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ

translations.translation: O Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy, and made an appointment with you on the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and sent down to you manna and quails,

verses.text: كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا۟ فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِى ۖ وَمَن يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِى فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ

translations.translation: [saying,] “Eat from the good things We have provided for you, but do not transgress in them, or My wrath will befall you. And whoever My wrath befalls is certainly doomed.

verses.text: وَإِنِّى لَغَفَّارٌ لِّمَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا ثُمَّ ٱهْتَدَىٰ

translations.translation: But I am truly Most Forgiving to whoever repents, believes, and does good, then persists on [true] guidance.”

verses.text: وَمَآ أَعْجَلَكَ عَن قَوْمِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: [Allah asked,] “Why have you come with such haste ahead of your people, O  Moses?”

verses.text: قَالَ هُمْ أُو۟لَآءِ عَلَىٰٓ أَثَرِى وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ

translations.translation: He replied, “They are close on my tracks. And I have hastened to You, my Lord, so You will be pleased.”

verses.text: قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ ٱلسَّامِرِىُّ

translations.translation: Allah responded, “We have indeed tested your people in your absence, and the Sâmiri has led them astray.”

verses.text: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ غَضْبَـٰنَ أَسِفًا ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدتُّمْ أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُم مَّوْعِدِى

translations.translation: So Moses returned to his people, furious and sorrowful. He said, “O my people! Had your Lord not made you a good promise? Has my absence been too long for you? Or have you wished for wrath from your Lord to befall you, so you broke your promise to me?”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ مَآ أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَـٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَآ أَوْزَارًا مِّن زِينَةِ ٱلْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَـٰهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّامِرِىُّ

translations.translation: They argued, “We did not break our promise to you of our own free will, but we were made to carry the burden of the people’s [golden] jewellery, then we threw it [into the fire], and so did the Sâmiri.”

verses.text: فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُۥ خُوَارٌ فَقَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَـٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِىَ

translations.translation: Then he moulded for them an idol of a calf that made a lowing sound. They said, “This is your god and the god of Moses, but Moses forgot [where it was]!”

verses.text: أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا

translations.translation: Did they not see that it did not respond to them, nor could it protect or benefit them?

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَـٰرُونُ مِن قَبْلُ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنتُم بِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَٱتَّبِعُونِى وَأَطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرِى

translations.translation: Aaron had already warned them beforehand, “O my people! You are only being tested by this, for indeed your [one true] Lord is the Most Compassionate. So follow me and obey my orders.”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ لَن نَّبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَـٰكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ

translations.translation: They replied, “We will not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us.”

verses.text: قَالَ يَـٰهَـٰرُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوٓا۟

translations.translation: Moses scolded [his brother], “O Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

verses.text: أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِى

translations.translation: from following after me? How could you disobey my orders?”

verses.text: قَالَ يَبْنَؤُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِى وَلَا بِرَأْسِىٓ ۖ إِنِّى خَشِيتُ أَن تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِى

translations.translation: Aaron pleaded, “O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard or [the hair of] my head. I really feared that you would say, ‘You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and did not observe my word.’”

verses.text: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَـٰسَـٰمِرِىُّ

translations.translation: Moses then asked, “What did you think you were doing, O  Sâmiri?”

verses.text: قَالَ بَصُرْتُ بِمَا لَمْ يَبْصُرُوا۟ بِهِۦ فَقَبَضْتُ قَبْضَةً مِّنْ أَثَرِ ٱلرَّسُولِ فَنَبَذْتُهَا وَكَذَٰلِكَ سَوَّلَتْ لِى نَفْسِى

translations.translation: He said, “I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the hoof-prints of [the horse of] the messenger-angel [Gabriel] then cast it [on the moulded calf]. This is what my lower-self tempted me into.”

verses.text: قَالَ فَٱذْهَبْ فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ أَن تَقُولَ لَا مِسَاسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَّن تُخْلَفَهُۥ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰٓ إِلَـٰهِكَ ٱلَّذِى ظَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفًا ۖ لَّنُحَرِّقَنَّهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَنسِفَنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ نَسْفًا

translations.translation: Moses said, “Go away then! And for [the rest of your] life you will surely be crying, ‘Do not touch [me]!’ Then you will certainly have a fate that you cannot escape. Now look at your god to which you have been devoted: we will burn it up, then scatter it in the sea completely.”

verses.text: إِنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًا

translations.translation: [Then Moses addressed his people,] “Your only god is Allah, there is no god [worthy of worship] except Him. He encompasses everything in [His] knowledge.”

verses.text: كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكَ مِن لَّدُنَّا ذِكْرًا

translations.translation: This is how We relate to you [O Prophet] some of the stories of the past. And We have certainly granted you a Reminder from Us.

verses.text: مَّنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وِزْرًا

translations.translation: Whoever turns away from it will surely bear the burden [of sin] on the Day of Judgment,

verses.text: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَآءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ حِمْلًا

translations.translation: suffering its consequences forever. What an evil burden they will carry on Judgment Day!

verses.text: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍ زُرْقًا

translations.translation: [Beware of] the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather the wicked on that Day blue-faced [from horror and thirst].

verses.text: يَتَخَـٰفَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًا

translations.translation: They will whisper among themselves, “You stayed no more than ten days [on the earth].”

verses.text: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًا

translations.translation: We know best what they will say—the most reasonable of them will say, “You stayed no more than a day.”

verses.text: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنسِفُهَا رَبِّى نَسْفًا

translations.translation: And [if] they ask you [O Prophet] about the mountains, [then] say, “My Lord will wipe them out completely,

verses.text: فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًا صَفْصَفًا

translations.translation: leaving the earth level and bare,

verses.text: لَّا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَآ أَمْتًا

translations.translation: with neither depressions nor elevations to be seen.”

verses.text: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعُونَ ٱلدَّاعِىَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُۥ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ ٱلْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًا

translations.translation: On that Day all will follow the caller [for assembly], [and] none will dare to deviate. All voices will be hushed before the Most Compassionate. Only whispers will be heard.

verses.text: يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا تَنفَعُ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَرَضِىَ لَهُۥ قَوْلًا

translations.translation: On that Day no intercession will be of any benefit, except by those granted permission by the Most Compassionate and whose words are agreeable to Him.

verses.text: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِۦ عِلْمًا

translations.translation: He [fully] knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them, but they cannot encompass Him in [their] knowledge.

verses.text: وَعَنَتِ ٱلْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَىِّ ٱلْقَيُّومِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًا

translations.translation: And all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. And those burdened with wrongdoing will be in loss.

verses.text: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا

translations.translation: But whoever does good and is a believer will have no fear of being wronged or denied [their reward].

verses.text: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَانًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًا

translations.translation: And so We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and varied the warnings in it, so perhaps they will shun evil or it may cause them to be mindful.

verses.text: فَتَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۗ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُقْضَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُۥ ۖ وَقُل رَّبِّ زِدْنِى عِلْمًا

translations.translation: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Do not rush to recite [a revelation of] the Quran [O Prophet] before it is [properly] conveyed to you, and pray, “My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.”

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ ءَادَمَ مِن قَبْلُ فَنَسِىَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُۥ عَزْمًا

translations.translation: And indeed, We once made a covenant with Adam, but he forgot, and [so] We did not find determination in him.

verses.text: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ

translations.translation: And [remember] when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, who refused [arrogantly].

verses.text: فَقُلْنَا يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا عَدُوٌّ لَّكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰٓ

translations.translation: So We cautioned, “O Adam! This is surely an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him drive you both out of Paradise, for you [O Adam] would then suffer [hardship].

verses.text: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ

translations.translation: Here it is guaranteed that you will never go hungry or unclothed,

verses.text: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَؤُا۟ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ

translations.translation: nor will you [ever] suffer from thirst or [the sun’s] heat.”

verses.text: فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ قَالَ يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ ٱلْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍ لَّا يَبْلَىٰ

translations.translation: But Satan whispered to him, saying, “O Adam! Shall I show you the Tree of Immortality and a kingdom that does not fade away?”

verses.text: فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰٓ ءَادَمُ رَبَّهُۥ فَغَوَىٰ

translations.translation: So they both ate from the tree and then their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. So Adam disobeyed his Lord, and [so] lost his way.

verses.text: ثُمَّ ٱجْتَبَـٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ

translations.translation: Then his Lord chose him [for His grace], accepted his repentance, and guided him [rightly].

verses.text: قَالَ ٱهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًۢا ۖ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّى هُدًى فَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ هُدَاىَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah said, “Descend, both of you, from here together [with Satan] as enemies to each other. Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in this life] nor suffer [in the next].

verses.text: وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَن ذِكْرِى فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ مَعِيشَةً ضَنكًا وَنَحْشُرُهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ أَعْمَىٰ

translations.translation: But whoever turns away from My Reminder will certainly have a miserable life, then We will raise them up blind on the Day of Judgment.”

verses.text: قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِىٓ أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنتُ بَصِيرًا

translations.translation: They will cry, “My Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, although I used to see?”

verses.text: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ ءَايَـٰتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ تُنسَىٰ

translations.translation: Allah will respond, “It is so, just as Our revelations came to you and you neglected them, so Today you are neglected.”

verses.text: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنۢ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ

translations.translation: This is how We reward whoever transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of their Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and more lasting.

verses.text: أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِى مَسَـٰكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ

translations.translation: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

verses.text: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى

translations.translation: Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord [O Prophet] and a term already set, their [instant] doom would have been inevitable.

verses.text: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ ءَانَآئِ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ ٱلنَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ

translations.translation: So be patient [O Prophet] with what they say. And glorify the praises of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset, and glorify Him in the hours of the night and at both ends of the day, so that you may be pleased [with the reward].

verses.text: وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًا مِّنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ

translations.translation: Do not let your eyes crave what We have allowed some of the disbelievers to enjoy; the [fleeting] splendour of this worldly life, which We test them with. But your Lord’s provision [in the Hereafter] is far better and more lasting.

verses.text: وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْـَٔلُكَ رِزْقًا ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ

translations.translation: Bid your people to pray, and be diligent in [observing] it. We do not ask you to provide. It is We Who provide for you. And the ultimate outcome is [only] for [the people of] righteousness.

verses.text: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِـَٔايَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِى ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ

translations.translation: They demand, “If only he could bring us a sign from his Lord!” Have they not [already] received a confirmation of what is in earlier Scriptures?

verses.text: وَلَوْ أَنَّآ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُم بِعَذَابٍ مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ لَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَوْلَآ أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ ءَايَـٰتِكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن نَّذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ

translations.translation: Had We destroyed them with a torment before this [Prophet came], they would have surely argued, “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and put to shame.”

verses.text: قُلْ كُلٌّ مُّتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ ٱلسَّوِىِّ وَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ

translations.translation: Say [to them, O  Prophet], “Each [of us] is waiting, so keep waiting! You will soon know who is on the Straight Path and is [rightly] guided.”

verses.text: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِى غَفْلَةٍ مُّعْرِضُونَ

translations.translation: [The time of] people’s judgment has drawn near, yet they are heedlessly turning away.

verses.text: مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِم مُّحْدَثٍ إِلَّا ٱسْتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ

translations.translation: Whatever new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they only listen to it jokingly,

verses.text: لَاهِيَةً قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّجْوَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ هَلْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ ۖ أَفَتَأْتُونَ ٱلسِّحْرَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ

translations.translation: with their hearts [totally] distracted. The evildoers would converse secretly, [saying,] “Is this [one] not human like yourselves? Would you fall for [this] witchcraft, even though you can [clearly] see?”

verses.text: قَالَ رَبِّى يَعْلَمُ ٱلْقَوْلَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ

translations.translation: The Prophet responded, “My Lord [fully] knows every word spoken in the heavens and the earth. For He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.”

verses.text: بَلْ قَالُوٓا۟ أَضْغَـٰثُ أَحْلَـٰمٍۭ بَلِ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ بَلْ هُوَ شَاعِرٌ فَلْيَأْتِنَا بِـَٔايَةٍ كَمَآ أُرْسِلَ ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ

translations.translation: Yet they say, “This [Quran] is a set of confused dreams! No, he has fabricated it! No, he must be a poet! So let him bring us a [tangible] sign like those [prophets] sent before.”

verses.text: مَآ ءَامَنَتْ قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَآ ۖ أَفَهُمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ

translations.translation: Not a [single] society We destroyed before them ever believed [after receiving the signs]. Will these [pagans] then believe?

verses.text: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُّوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ فَسْـَٔلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلذِّكْرِ إِن كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ

translations.translation: We did not send [messengers] before you [O Prophet] except mere men inspired by Us. If you [polytheists] do not know [this already], then ask those who have knowledge [of the Scriptures].

verses.text: وَمَا جَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ جَسَدًا لَّا يَأْكُلُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ خَـٰلِدِينَ

translations.translation: We did not give those messengers [supernatural] bodies that did not need food, nor were they immortal.

verses.text: ثُمَّ صَدَقْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْوَعْدَ فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُمْ وَمَن نَّشَآءُ وَأَهْلَكْنَا ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ

translations.translation: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, saving them along with whoever We willed and destroying the transgressors.

verses.text: لَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ كِتَـٰبًا فِيهِ ذِكْرُكُمْ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ

translations.translation: We have surely revealed to you a Book, in which there is glory for you. Will you not then understand?

verses.text: وَكَمْ قَصَمْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ كَانَتْ ظَالِمَةً وَأَنشَأْنَا بَعْدَهَا قَوْمًا ءَاخَرِينَ

translations.translation: [Imagine] how many societies of wrongdoers We have destroyed, raising up other people after them!

verses.text: فَلَمَّآ أَحَسُّوا۟ بَأْسَنَآ إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَرْكُضُونَ

translations.translation: When the wrongdoers sensed [the arrival of] Our torment, they started to run away from their cities.

verses.text: لَا تَرْكُضُوا۟ وَٱرْجِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَآ أُتْرِفْتُمْ فِيهِ وَمَسَـٰكِنِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْـَٔلُونَ

translations.translation: [They were told,] “Do not run away! Return to your luxuries and your homes, so you may be questioned [about your fate].”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: They cried, “Woe to us! We have surely been wrongdoers.”

verses.text: فَمَا زَالَت تِّلْكَ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَـٰمِدِينَ

translations.translation: They kept repeating their cry until We mowed them down, [leaving them] lifeless.

verses.text: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَـٰعِبِينَ

translations.translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between for sport.

verses.text: لَوْ أَرَدْنَآ أَن نَّتَّخِذَ لَهْوًا لَّٱتَّخَذْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّآ إِن كُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ

translations.translation: Had We intended to take [some] amusement, We could have found it in Our presence, if that had been Our Will.

verses.text: بَلْ نَقْذِفُ بِٱلْحَقِّ عَلَى ٱلْبَـٰطِلِ فَيَدْمَغُهُۥ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٌ ۚ وَلَكُمُ ٱلْوَيْلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ

translations.translation: In fact, We hurl the truth against falsehood, leaving it crushed, and it quickly vanishes. And woe be to you for what you claim!

verses.text: وَلَهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَنْ عِندَهُۥ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِۦ وَلَا يَسْتَحْسِرُونَ

translations.translation: To Him belong all those in the heavens and the earth. And those nearest to Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire.

verses.text: يُسَبِّحُونَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ لَا يَفْتُرُونَ

translations.translation: They glorify [Him] day and night, never wavering.

verses.text: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَةً مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ هُمْ يُنشِرُونَ

translations.translation: Or have they taken gods from the earth, who can raise the dead?

verses.text: لَوْ كَانَ فِيهِمَآ ءَالِهَةٌ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَا ۚ فَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

translations.translation: Had there been other gods besides Allah in the heavens or the earth, both [realms] would have surely been corrupted. So Glorified is Allah, Lord of the Throne, far above what they claim.

verses.text: لَا يُسْـَٔلُ عَمَّا يَفْعَلُ وَهُمْ يُسْـَٔلُونَ

translations.translation: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will [all] be questioned.

verses.text: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةً ۖ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ ۖ هَـٰذَا ذِكْرُ مَن مَّعِىَ وَذِكْرُ مَن قَبْلِى ۗ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ فَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ

translations.translation: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say, [O Prophet,] “Show [me] your proof. Here is [the Quran,] the Reminder for those with me; along with [earlier Scriptures,] the Reminder for those before me.” But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.

verses.text: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱعْبُدُونِ

translations.translation: We never sent a messenger before you [O Prophet] without revealing to him: “There is no god [worthy of worship] except Me, so worship Me [alone].”

verses.text: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۚ بَلْ عِبَادٌ مُّكْرَمُونَ

translations.translation: And they say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring!” Glory be to Him! In fact, those [angels] are only [His] honoured servants,

verses.text: لَا يَسْبِقُونَهُۥ بِٱلْقَوْلِ وَهُم بِأَمْرِهِۦ يَعْمَلُونَ

translations.translation: who do not speak until He has spoken, [only] acting at His command.

verses.text: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يَشْفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ وَهُم مِّنْ خَشْيَتِهِۦ مُشْفِقُونَ

translations.translation: He [fully] knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. They do not intercede except for whom He approves, and they tremble in awe of Him.

verses.text: وَمَن يَقُلْ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّىٓ إِلَـٰهٌ مِّن دُونِهِۦ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: Whoever of them were to say, “I am a god besides Him,” they would be rewarded with Hell by Us. This is how We reward the wrongdoers.

verses.text: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًا فَفَتَقْنَـٰهُمَا ۖ وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ حَىٍّ ۖ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

translations.translation: Do the disbelievers not realize that the heavens and earth were [once] one mass then We split them apart? And We created from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?

verses.text: وَجَعَلْنَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِهِمْ وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجًا سُبُلًا لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ

translations.translation: And We have placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with them, and made in it broad pathways so they may find their way.

verses.text: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ سَقْفًا مَّحْفُوظًا ۖ وَهُمْ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ

translations.translation: And We have made the sky a well-protected canopy, still they turn away from its signs.

verses.text: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ فِى فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ

translations.translation: And He is the One Who created the day and the night, the sun and the moon—each travelling in an orbit.

verses.text: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا لِبَشَرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ ٱلْخُلْدَ ۖ أَفَإِي۟ن مِّتَّ فَهُمُ ٱلْخَـٰلِدُونَ

translations.translation: We have not granted immortality to any human before you [O Prophet]: so if you die, will they live forever?

verses.text: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَآئِقَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۗ وَنَبْلُوكُم بِٱلشَّرِّ وَٱلْخَيْرِ فِتْنَةً ۖ وَإِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ

translations.translation: Every soul will taste death. And We test you [O humanity] with good and evil as a trial, then to Us you will [all] be returned.

verses.text: وَإِذَا رَءَاكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَذْكُرُ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ

translations.translation: When the disbelievers see you [O Prophet], they only make fun of you, [saying,] “Is this the one who speaks [ill] of your gods?” while they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Compassionate.

verses.text: خُلِقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مِنْ عَجَلٍ ۚ سَأُو۟رِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِى فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونِ

translations.translation: Humankind is made of haste. I will soon show you My signs, so do not ask Me to hasten them.

verses.text: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ

translations.translation: They ask [the believers], “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”

verses.text: لَوْ يَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَن وُجُوهِهِمُ ٱلنَّارَ وَلَا عَن ظُهُورِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ

translations.translation: If only the disbelievers knew that a time will come when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces or backs, nor will they be helped.

verses.text: بَلْ تَأْتِيهِم بَغْتَةً فَتَبْهَتُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ

translations.translation: In fact, the Hour will take them by surprise, leaving them stunned. So they will not be able to avert it, nor will it be delayed from them.

verses.text: وَلَقَدِ ٱسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِٱلَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا۟ مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ

translations.translation: [Other] messengers had already been ridiculed before you [O Prophet], but those who mocked them were overtaken by what they used to ridicule.

verses.text: قُلْ مَن يَكْلَؤُكُم بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ مِنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۗ بَلْ هُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ

translations.translation: Ask [them, O  Prophet,] “Who can defend you by day or by night against the Most Compassionate?” Still they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

verses.text: أَمْ لَهُمْ ءَالِهَةٌ تَمْنَعُهُم مِّن دُونِنَا ۚ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَلَا هُم مِّنَّا يُصْحَبُونَ

translations.translation: Or do they have gods—other than Us—that can protect them? They cannot [even] protect themselves, nor will they be aided against Us.

verses.text: بَلْ مَتَّعْنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَءَابَآءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْعُمُرُ ۗ أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّا نَأْتِى ٱلْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَآ ۚ أَفَهُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ

translations.translation: In fact, We have allowed enjoyment for these [Meccans] and their forefathers for such a long time [that they took it for granted]. Do they not see that We gradually reduce [their] land from its borders? Is it they who will then prevail?

verses.text: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أُنذِرُكُم بِٱلْوَحْىِ ۚ وَلَا يَسْمَعُ ٱلصُّمُّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا مَا يُنذَرُونَ

translations.translation: Say, [O Prophet,] “I warn you only by revelation.” But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned!

verses.text: وَلَئِن مَّسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌ مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: If they were touched by even a breath of your Lord’s torment, they would certainly cry, “Woe to us! We have really been wrongdoers.”

verses.text: وَنَضَعُ ٱلْمَوَٰزِينَ ٱلْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَلَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَإِن كَانَ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍ أَتَيْنَا بِهَا ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِنَا حَـٰسِبِينَ

translations.translation: We set up the scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so no soul will be wronged in the least. And [even] if a deed is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as a [vigilant] Reckoner.

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ وَضِيَآءً وَذِكْرًا لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ

translations.translation: Indeed, We granted Moses and Aaron the decisive authority—a light and a reminder for the righteous,

verses.text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَهُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّاعَةِ مُشْفِقُونَ

translations.translation: who are in awe of their Lord without seeing Him, and are fearful of the Hour.

verses.text: وَهَـٰذَا ذِكْرٌ مُّبَارَكٌ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ ۚ أَفَأَنتُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ

translations.translation: And this [Quran] is a blessed reminder which We have revealed. Will you [pagans] then deny it?

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ رُشْدَهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِۦ عَـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: And indeed, We had granted Abraham sound judgment early on, for We knew him well [to be worthy of it].

verses.text: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلتَّمَاثِيلُ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنتُمْ لَهَا عَـٰكِفُونَ

translations.translation: [Remember] when he questioned his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are so devoted?”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا لَهَا عَـٰبِدِينَ

translations.translation: They replied, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”

verses.text: قَالَ لَقَدْ كُنتُمْ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُمْ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ

translations.translation: He responded, “Indeed, you and your forefathers have been clearly astray.”

verses.text: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ أَمْ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱللَّـٰعِبِينَ

translations.translation: They asked, “Have you come to us with the truth, or is this a joke?”

verses.text: قَالَ بَل رَّبُّكُمْ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا۠ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ

translations.translation: He replied, “In fact, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them [both]. And to that I bear witness.”

verses.text: وَتَٱللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَـٰمَكُم بَعْدَ أَن تُوَلُّوا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ

translations.translation: [Then he said to himself,] “By Allah! I will surely plot against your idols after you have turned your backs and gone away.”

verses.text: فَجَعَلَهُمْ جُذَٰذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرًا لَّهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُونَ

translations.translation: So he smashed them into pieces, except the biggest of them, so they might turn to it [for answers].

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ مَن فَعَلَ هَـٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَآ إِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: They protested, “Who dared do this to our gods? It must be an evildoer!”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا فَتًى يَذْكُرُهُمْ يُقَالُ لَهُۥٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ

translations.translation: Some said, “We heard a young man, called Abraham, speaking [ill] of them.”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ فَأْتُوا۟ بِهِۦ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ

translations.translation: They demanded, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness [his trial].”

verses.text: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَأَنتَ فَعَلْتَ هَـٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَا يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ

translations.translation: They asked, “Was it you who did this to our gods, O  Abraham?”

verses.text: قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُۥ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَـٰذَا فَسْـَٔلُوهُمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ يَنطِقُونَ

translations.translation: He replied [sarcastically], “No, this one—the biggest of them—did it! So ask them, if they can talk!”

verses.text: فَرَجَعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ أَنتُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ

translations.translation: So they came back to their senses, saying [to one another], “You yourselves are truly the wrongdoers!”

verses.text: ثُمَّ نُكِسُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رُءُوسِهِمْ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ يَنطِقُونَ

translations.translation: Then they [quickly] regressed to their [original] mind-set, [arguing,] “You already know that those [idols] cannot talk.”

verses.text: قَالَ أَفَتَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمْ

translations.translation: He rebuked [them], “Do you then worship—instead of Allah—what can neither benefit nor harm you in any way?

verses.text: أُفٍّ لَّكُمْ وَلِمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ

translations.translation: Shame on you and whatever you worship instead of Allah! Do you not have any sense?”

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ حَرِّقُوهُ وَٱنصُرُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ

translations.translation: They concluded, “Burn him up to avenge your gods, if you must act.”

verses.text: قُلْنَا يَـٰنَارُ كُونِى بَرْدًا وَسَلَـٰمًا عَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ

translations.translation: We ordered, “O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!”

verses.text: وَأَرَادُوا۟ بِهِۦ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ

translations.translation: They had sought to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

verses.text: وَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا لِلْعَـٰلَمِينَ

translations.translation: Then We delivered him, along with Lot, to the land We had showered with blessings for all people.

verses.text: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةً ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا صَـٰلِحِينَ

translations.translation: And We blessed him with Isaac [as a son] and Jacob [as a grandson], as an additional favour—making all of them righteous.

verses.text: وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَهْدُونَ بِأَمْرِنَا وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِمْ فِعْلَ ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَإِقَامَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَإِيتَآءَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةِ ۖ وَكَانُوا۟ لَنَا عَـٰبِدِينَ

translations.translation: We [also] made them leaders, guiding by Our command, and inspired them to do good deeds, establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. And they were devoted to Our worship.

verses.text: وَلُوطًا ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا وَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِى كَانَت تَّعْمَلُ ٱلْخَبَـٰٓئِثَ ۗ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَـٰسِقِينَ

translations.translation: And to Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and delivered him from the society engrossed in shameful practices. They were certainly an evil, rebellious people.

verses.text: وَأَدْخَلْنَـٰهُ فِى رَحْمَتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ

translations.translation: And We admitted him into Our mercy, [for] he was truly one of the righteous.

verses.text: وَنُوحًا إِذْ نَادَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ فَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْكَرْبِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ

translations.translation: And [remember] when Noah had cried out to Us earlier, so We responded to him and delivered him and his family from the great distress.

verses.text: وَنَصَرْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

translations.translation: And We made him prevail over those who had rejected Our signs. They were truly an evil people, so We drowned them all.

verses.text: وَدَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَـٰنَ إِذْ يَحْكُمَانِ فِى ٱلْحَرْثِ إِذْ نَفَشَتْ فِيهِ غَنَمُ ٱلْقَوْمِ وَكُنَّا لِحُكْمِهِمْ شَـٰهِدِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] when David and Solomon passed judgment regarding the crops ruined [at night] by someone’s sheep, and We were witness to their judgments.

verses.text: فَفَهَّمْنَـٰهَا سُلَيْمَـٰنَ ۚ وَكُلًّا ءَاتَيْنَا حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَسَخَّرْنَا مَعَ دَاوُۥدَ ٱلْجِبَالَ يُسَبِّحْنَ وَٱلطَّيْرَ ۚ وَكُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ

translations.translation: We guided [young] Solomon to a fairer settlement, and granted each of them wisdom and knowledge. We subjected the mountains as well as the birds to hymn [Our praises] along with David. It is We Who did [it all].

verses.text: وَعَلَّمْنَـٰهُ صَنْعَةَ لَبُوسٍ لَّكُمْ لِتُحْصِنَكُم مِّنۢ بَأْسِكُمْ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُمْ شَـٰكِرُونَ

translations.translation: We taught him the art of making body armour to protect you in battle. Will you then be grateful?

verses.text: وَلِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ ٱلرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةً تَجْرِى بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا ۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: And to Solomon We subjected the raging winds, blowing by his command to the land We had showered with blessings. It is We Who know everything.

verses.text: وَمِنَ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينِ مَن يَغُوصُونَ لَهُۥ وَيَعْمَلُونَ عَمَلًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمْ حَـٰفِظِينَ

translations.translation: And [We subjected] some jinn that dived for him, and performed other duties. It is We Who kept them in check.

verses.text: وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] when Job cried out to his Lord, “I have been touched with adversity, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”

verses.text: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ فَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِۦ مِن ضُرٍّ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ أَهْلَهُۥ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَـٰبِدِينَ

translations.translation: So We answered his prayer and removed his adversity, and gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for the [devoted] worshippers.

verses.text: وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِدْرِيسَ وَذَا ٱلْكِفْلِ ۖ كُلٌّ مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] Ishmael, Enoch, and Ⱬul-Kifl. They were all steadfast.

verses.text: وَأَدْخَلْنَـٰهُمْ فِى رَحْمَتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ

translations.translation: We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were truly of the righteous.

verses.text: وَذَا ٱلنُّونِ إِذ ذَّهَبَ مُغَـٰضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَن لَّن نَّقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِى ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ أَن لَّآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنتَ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ إِنِّى كُنتُ مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] when the Man of the Whale stormed off [from his city] in a rage, thinking We would not restrain him. Then in the [veils of] darkness he cried out, “There is no god [worthy of worship] except You. Glory be to You! I have certainly done wrong.”

verses.text: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ وَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلْغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُـۨجِى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

translations.translation: So We answered his prayer and rescued him from anguish. And so do We save the [true] believers.

verses.text: وَزَكَرِيَّآ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِى فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] when Zachariah cried out to his Lord, “My Lord! Do not leave me childless, though You are the Best of Successors.”

verses.text: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ وَأَصْلَحْنَا لَهُۥ زَوْجَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا ۖ وَكَانُوا۟ لَنَا خَـٰشِعِينَ

translations.translation: So We answered his prayer, granted him John, and made his wife fertile. Indeed, they used to race in doing good, and call upon Us with hope and fear, totally humbling themselves before Us.

verses.text: وَٱلَّتِىٓ أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهَا مِن رُّوحِنَا وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا وَٱبْنَهَآ ءَايَةً لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ

translations.translation: And [remember] the one who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her through Our angel, [Gabriel,] making her and her son a sign for all peoples.

verses.text: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَٰحِدَةً وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُونِ

translations.translation: [O prophets!] Indeed, this religion of yours is [only] one, and I am your Lord, so worship Me [alone].

verses.text: وَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلٌّ إِلَيْنَا رَٰجِعُونَ

translations.translation: Yet the people have divided it into sects. But to Us they will all return.

verses.text: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا كُفْرَانَ لِسَعْيِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ كَـٰتِبُونَ

translations.translation: So whoever does good and is a believer will never be denied [the reward for] their striving, for We are recording it all.

verses.text: وَحَرَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَآ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ

translations.translation: It is impossible for a society which We have destroyed to ever rise again,

verses.text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنسِلُونَ

translations.translation: until [after] Gog and Magog have broken loose [from the barrier], swarming down from every hill,

verses.text: وَٱقْتَرَبَ ٱلْوَعْدُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِىَ شَـٰخِصَةٌ أَبْصَـٰرُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَا قَدْ كُنَّا فِى غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا بَلْ كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ

translations.translation: ushering in the True Promise. Then—behold!—the disbelievers will stare [in horror, crying,] “Oh, woe to us! We have truly been heedless of this. In fact, we have been wrongdoers.”

verses.text: إِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُمْ لَهَا وَٰرِدُونَ

translations.translation: Certainly you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship instead of Allah will be the fuel of Hell. You are [all] bound to enter it.

verses.text: لَوْ كَانَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ءَالِهَةً مَّا وَرَدُوهَا ۖ وَكُلٌّ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ

translations.translation: Had those idols been [true] gods, they would not have entered it. And they will be there forever.

verses.text: لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌ وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يَسْمَعُونَ

translations.translation: In it they will groan, and will not be able to hear.

verses.text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقَتْ لَهُم مِّنَّا ٱلْحُسْنَىٰٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَنْهَا مُبْعَدُونَ

translations.translation: Surely those for whom We have destined the finest reward will be kept far away from Hell,

verses.text: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَا ۖ وَهُمْ فِى مَا ٱشْتَهَتْ أَنفُسُهُمْ خَـٰلِدُونَ

translations.translation: not even hearing the slightest hissing from it. And they will delight forever in what their souls desire.

verses.text: لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ ٱلْفَزَعُ ٱلْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ هَـٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ

translations.translation: The Supreme Horror [of that Day] will not disturb them, and the angels will greet them, [saying,] “This is your Day, which you have been promised.”

verses.text: يَوْمَ نَطْوِى ٱلسَّمَآءَ كَطَىِّ ٱلسِّجِلِّ لِلْكُتُبِ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأْنَآ أَوَّلَ خَلْقٍ نُّعِيدُهُۥ ۚ وَعْدًا عَلَيْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ

translations.translation: On that Day We will roll up the heavens like a scroll of writings. Just as We produced the first creation, [so] shall We reproduce it. That is a promise binding on Us. We truly uphold [Our promises]!

verses.text: وَلَقَدْ كَتَبْنَا فِى ٱلزَّبُورِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلذِّكْرِ أَنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ يَرِثُهَا عِبَادِىَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ

translations.translation: Surely, following the [heavenly] Record, We decreed in the Scriptures: “My righteous servants shall inherit the land.”

verses.text: إِنَّ فِى هَـٰذَا لَبَلَـٰغًا لِّقَوْمٍ عَـٰبِدِينَ

translations.translation: Surely this [Quran] is sufficient [as a reminder] for those devoted to worship.

verses.text: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا رَحْمَةً لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ

translations.translation: We have sent you [O Prophet] only as a mercy for the whole world.

verses.text: قُلْ إِنَّمَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ

translations.translation: Say, “What has been revealed to me is this: ‘Your God is only One God.’ Will you then submit?”

verses.text: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُلْ ءَاذَنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍ ۖ وَإِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ أَم بَعِيدٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ

translations.translation: If they turn away, then say, “I have warned you all equally. I do not know if what you are threatened with is near or far.

verses.text: إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْتُمُونَ

translations.translation: Allah surely knows what you say openly and whatever you hide.

verses.text: وَإِنْ أَدْرِى لَعَلَّهُۥ فِتْنَةٌ لَّكُمْ وَمَتَـٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ

translations.translation: I do not know if this [delay] is possibly a test for you and an enjoyment for a while.”

verses.text: قَـٰلَ رَبِّ ٱحْكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَرَبُّنَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ

translations.translation: [In the end,] the Prophet said, “My Lord! Judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Compassionate, Whose help is sought against what you claim.”

verses.text: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ زَلْزَلَةَ ٱلسَّاعَةِ شَىْءٌ عَظِيمٌ

translations.translation: O humanity! Fear your Lord, for the [violent] quaking at the Hour is surely a dreadful thing.

verses.text: يَوْمَ تَرَوْنَهَا تَذْهَلُ كُلُّ مُرْضِعَةٍ عَمَّآ أَرْضَعَتْ وَتَضَعُ كُلُّ ذَاتِ حَمْلٍ حَمْلَهَا وَتَرَى ٱلنَّاسَ سُكَـٰرَىٰ وَمَا هُم بِسُكَـٰرَىٰ وَلَـٰكِنَّ عَذَابَ ٱللَّهِ شَدِيدٌ

translations.translation: The Day you see it, every nursing mother will abandon what she is nursing, and every pregnant woman will deliver her burden [prematurely]. And you will see people [as if they were] drunk, though they will not be drunk; but the torment of Allah is [terribly] severe.

verses.text: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَيَتَّبِعُ كُلَّ شَيْطَـٰنٍ مَّرِيدٍ

translations.translation: [Still] there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, and follow every rebellious devil.

verses.text: كُتِبَ عَلَيْهِ أَنَّهُۥ مَن تَوَلَّاهُ فَأَنَّهُۥ يُضِلُّهُۥ وَيَهْدِيهِ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ

translations.translation: It has been decreed for such devils that whoever takes them as a guide will be misguided and led by them into the torment of the Blaze.

verses.text: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمْ فِى رَيْبٍ مِّنَ ٱلْبَعْثِ فَإِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰكُم مِّن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِنْ عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن مُّضْغَةٍ مُّخَلَّقَةٍ وَغَيْرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍ لِّنُبَيِّنَ لَكُمْ ۚ وَنُقِرُّ فِى ٱلْأَرْحَامِ مَا نَشَآءُ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ثُمَّ نُخْرِجُكُمْ طِفْلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبْلُغُوٓا۟ أَشُدَّكُمْ ۖ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُتَوَفَّىٰ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَرْذَلِ ٱلْعُمُرِ لِكَيْلَا يَعْلَمَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ عِلْمٍ شَيْـًٔا ۚ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ هَامِدَةً فَإِذَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهَا ٱلْمَآءَ ٱهْتَزَّتْ وَرَبَتْ وَأَنۢبَتَتْ مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍ

translations.translation: O humanity! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then [know that] We did create you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then [developed you into] a clinging clot, then a lump of flesh—fully formed or unformed—in order to demonstrate [Our power] to you. [Then] We settle whatever [embryo] We will in the womb for an appointed term, then bring you forth as infants, so that you may reach your prime. Some of you [may] die [young], while others are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. And you see the earth lifeless, but as soon as We send down rain upon it, it begins to stir [to life] and swell, producing every type of pleasant plant.

verses.text: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّهُۥ يُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَأَنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ

translations.translation: That is because Allah [alone] is the Truth, He [alone] gives life to the dead, and He [alone] is Most Capable of everything.

verses.text: وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ ءَاتِيَةٌ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهَا وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَبْعَثُ مَن فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ

translations.translation: And certainly the Hour is coming, there is no doubt about it. And Allah will surely resurrect those in the graves.

verses.text: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَلَا هُدًى وَلَا كِتَـٰبٍ مُّنِيرٍ

translations.translation: [Still] there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, guidance, or an enlightening scripture,

verses.text: ثَانِىَ عِطْفِهِۦ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَهُۥ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا خِزْىٌ ۖ وَنُذِيقُهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عَذَابَ ٱلْحَرِيقِ

translations.translation: turning away [in pride] to lead [others] astray from Allah’s Way. They will suffer disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Judgment We will make them taste the torment of burning.

verses.text: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاكَ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّـٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ

translations.translation: [They will be told,] “This is [the reward] for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to [His] creation.”

verses.text: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَعْبُدُ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ حَرْفٍ ۖ فَإِنْ أَصَابَهُۥ خَيْرٌ ٱطْمَأَنَّ بِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنْ أَصَابَتْهُ فِتْنَةٌ ٱنقَلَبَ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦ خَسِرَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْخُسْرَانُ ٱلْمُبِينُ

translations.translation: And there are some who worship Allah on the verge [of faith]: if they are blessed with something good, they are content with it; but if they are afflicted with a trial, they relapse [into disbelief], losing this world and the Hereafter. That is [truly] the clearest loss.

verses.text: يَدْعُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَضُرُّهُۥ وَمَا لَا يَنفَعُهُۥ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلضَّلَـٰلُ ٱلْبَعِيدُ

translations.translation: They call besides Allah what can neither harm nor benefit them. That is [truly] the farthest one can stray.
